Package com.gemalto.mfs.mwsdk.payment

Interface CVMResetTimeoutListener

public interface CVMResetTimeoutListener
Interface to receive the count down event after the CardHolder verification input has been entered.
For security reason, the CardHolder verification input should not stay too long in memory. The timeout duration is mandated in the card profile and the credentials shall be invalidated (wiped away from memory) after the timeout event has kicked in.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    onCredentialsTimeout(PaymentService activatedPaymentService, CHVerificationMethod cvm, long cvmResetTimeout)
    Call backed once the the timer to wait for End User to tap to the POS has timed out.
    void
    onCredentialsTimeoutCountDown(int remainingSeconds)
    Called back after the End User has perform the CardHolder verification upon the receipt of PaymentServiceListener.onAuthenticationRequired(PaymentService, CHVerificationMethod, long) .

  • Method Details

    • onCredentialsTimeoutCountDown

      void onCredentialsTimeoutCountDown(int remainingSeconds)
      Called back after the End User has perform the CardHolder verification upon the receipt of PaymentServiceListener.onAuthenticationRequired(PaymentService, CHVerificationMethod, long) . This allows the UI to update until the timeout of the credentials (which is loaded from either the card profile or the default value).
      Once the credentials has timed out, the onCredentialsTimeout(PaymentService, CHVerificationMethod, long) will be called and the SDK expects the UI application to re-perform the CardHolder verification process.
      Parameters:
      remainingSeconds - Remaining seconds before the credentials are set.

    • onCredentialsTimeout

      void onCredentialsTimeout(PaymentService activatedPaymentService, CHVerificationMethod cvm, long cvmResetTimeout)
      Call backed once the the timer to wait for End User to tap to the POS has timed out. The UI application could once again call PaymentService.getCHVerifier(CHVerificationMethod) to show the credential input to the End User. Otherwise, the transaction can be canceled by triggering PaymentBusinessService.deactivate()
      Parameters:
      activatedPaymentService - The currently activate PaymentService (which represents the card to pay).
      cvm - The CVM option which indicates which method to verify the CardHolder (refer to PaymentService.getCHVerifier(CHVerificationMethod) for details).
      cvmResetTimeout - Timeout duration after the CH has been verified in seconds.
